conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful note and for your continued interest in Nursery_C. I want to be transparent: there is a realistic scenario in which we could consider you, but it depends on whether higher-priority families for our final place apply and remain available in the next rounds.

In particular, one higher-priority family (Parent_B) may still approach us if they do not secure their top option elsewhere. If that happens, we would need to follow our priority order. If those higher-priority options are no longer in play, then your application would become much more competitive for us.

So, I wouldn’t say you should stop pursuing Nursery_C—but I also recommend you continue actively pursuing your other preferred nurseries in parallel, because we cannot guarantee an offer from our side.

If you’d like, you can check in again next round; we’ll continue to respond as the situation becomes clearer.

Warm regards,
Nursery_C

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for applying again, and for your patience. Yes—our plan is still to hold our single remaining place through the end of round 12 primarily for an actual [APPLY] from Parent_B (or another higher-priority family). Because we must follow our priority order and we are still within the hold window we communicated, we’re not able to offer you the place this round.

If no higher-priority [APPLY] arrives by the end of round 12, we will reassess immediately. If you are still available then, please do apply again in round 13 and we will make a decision based on the situation at that point.
